subject: Turn off debug logging in sqlalchemy by default

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

messages.message:
Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

also if we pass debug in sqlalchemy passwords tend to leak into the logs. Very big +1 for turning this off.

Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It looks like someone went out of their way to enable debug mode in sqlalchemy.  Turning on db debugging was clearly not just a side effect of some other intention, it appears to have been quite deliberate.  Are we sure we want to disable this entirely?  Can you arrange it so db debug messages is a specific conf setting?  Or perhaps have them go to a different file?  Leaking of PWs is obviously a big problem that should be solved but maybe there is another way.

note that I am not opposed to doing this, but I think we need to explicitly address whatever the historical reason was for enabling this.

Patch Set 1:

Yeah I can respin this as an extra config option that defaults to false if you'd like.

Looking at the git history on the commit shows that Jay Pipes was the one who added this back in 2011 with:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/863/

and has just been updated and carried around since then. It looks like the original intent was to ensure that connection and import errors were being shown.(turning debug for this is like going at the problem with a hammer though) Which I don't think will be a problem any more since the db code has matured quite a bit since then.

Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I will let Jay Pipes speak to whether or not this needs to be configurable, but making this less verbose will make logstash very happy. +1 from me.

Patch Set 1: Works for me

Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Matthew, those comments make sense to me.  If Jay and others are good with it than I am too.  I would certainly be pleased to no longer scroll though a hundred lines of SQL while debugging!

Patch Set 1: Works for me

SmokeStack Results (patch set 1):
	Libvirt (Fedora 18) Success: http://smokestack.openstack.org/?go=/jobs/100843

Patch Set 1:

what would I have to do in case I do want to see the sql query logs if this patch gets in?

Patch Set 1:

You'd have to manually pass logging.DEBUG debug level to the sa_logger to get the same level of information that currently is returned with debug logging turned on. (All queries and results being returned)

Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Rather than just changing this behavior, how about adding a config setting to turn *off* sql debugging logs even if debug = true? Or, weaker, separate out sql logging to its own debug config setting.

Patch Set 1:

is anyone actually using it actively? from my experience reading lots of glance logs in the gate this really just cruds everything up, and means credentials can get dumped in the logs because we can't scrub them in sqla.

Patch Set 1:

Yes, people use it for manual debugging.

But as you suggest, it is not used that frequently, and is not necessary to be on all the time that other debug logging is on.

Perhaps the "weaker" form of preserving compatibility is most appropriate--this patch should add a new config setting that turns sqlalchemy debug logging on.

Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Yes, I sometimes use it for manual debugging especially on my dev environment. It's kind of handy at times.

IMHO, a new config setting with sqlalchemy debug turned off by default is probably the way to go.

+1 for Mark's comments.
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

LGTM, minor point.

Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks Mathew for inclusion of the 'sqlalchemy_debug' conf property. This would be of great help.

The below points are for your consideration. Thought, if they could be included as part of this check-in it would be great. 
#1:
From the SQLAlchemy documentation, these are some minor details I could extract out:

Setting log level to,
WARN: no log operation occurs. (this is the log level that is set as default)
		eg., logging.getLogger('sqlalchemy.engine').setLevel(logging.WARN)
INFO: logs all SQL statements + repr() of their parameter list.
		eg., logging.getLogger('sqlalchemy.engine').setLevel(logging.INFO)
DEBUG: logs all SQL statements + parameter list + result rows
		eg., logging.getLogger('sqlalchemy.engine').setLevel(logging.DEBUG)

I think most of the times what we want was log at INFO level during development. Generally we might not want to log all the result rows which makes the logs very exhaustive.

If we make CONF.sqlalchemy_debug to have values either as DEBUG|INFO|WARN as part of this check-in that would be a big plus.
	eg., sqlalchemy_debug = False (means set to WARN)
		 sqlalchemy_debug = True (means set log level to INFO) 		
		 sqlalchemy_debug = 'debug' (means set log level to DEBUG)
This is the same way how sqlalchemy's keyword parameter, 'echo' is set while invoking create_engine().

#2:
If we could change the name of the CONF property from 'sqlalchemy_debug' to some thing like 'sql_connection_debug' or 'connection_debug' as defined in nova, it would sound consistent with rest of the properties used for SQLAlchemy from both glance-api.conf & glance-registry.conf.
Uploaded patch set 4.
